article.title: The View from the Tower of Babel
article.author: Gore, D.
article.text: A funny thing happened on the way to the biggest building boom in library history. Book collections grew faster than the new space to hold them, so when the boom was over the aggregate space problem of academic libraries was a little worse than it was at the beginning. During the roughly eight-year span of the rise and fall of the boom, some 570 new or expanded library buildings sprang up on the campuses of four-year and graduate institutions around the nation.
